ab initio.example: The contract was void ab initio.

actus reus.example: Actus reus and mens rea must be proven.

ad hoc.usage: Created for a specific purpose only.
ad hoc.example: An ad hoc committee was formed.

alibi.usage: Defense claiming physical absence from crime scene.
alibi.example: The defendant provided a solid alibi.

amicus curiae.example: The advocate was appointed as amicus curiae.

audi alteram partem.example: Order quashed for violation of audi alteram partem.

bona fide.example: The purchaser was a bona fide buyer.

caveat emptor.example: It was the buyer's duty to inspect goods.

certiorari.usage: Writ to review a lower court's decision.
certiorari.example: High Court issued a writ of certiorari.

consensus ad idem.usage: Parties agreeing to same thing in same sense.
consensus ad idem.example: No contract without consensus ad idem.

de facto.usage: Existing in reality, though not official.
de facto.example: He was the de facto head.

de jure.example: The de jure owner retained legal title.

de novo.usage: Starting a trial over from the beginning.
de novo.example: The court ordered a de novo trial.

ex parte.usage: Proceedings with only one party present.
ex parte.example: An ex parte order was passed.

habeas corpus.example: A habeas corpus petition was filed.

ignorantia juris non excusat.meaning: Ignorance of law is no excuse
ignorantia juris non excusat.usage: Cannot escape liability by claiming ignorance of law.
ignorantia juris non excusat.example: Accused was convicted as ignorantia juris non excusat.

in personam.usage: Rights enforceable against a specific person.

in rem.example: Property rights are rights in rem.

inter alia.usage: Used when listing items from a larger set.
inter alia.example: The petition challenged, inter alia, validity.

locus standi.usage: Right to bring action in court.

mens rea.example: Mens rea is an essential ingredient.

nemo judex in causa sua.meaning: No one should be judge in their own cause
nemo judex in causa sua.example: Order violated nemo judex in causa sua.

non compos mentis.example: The deed was void as executor was non compos mentis.

pari passu.example: Creditors shall be paid pari passu.

prima facie.example: A prima facie case was made out.

quid pro quo.example: Every contract requires quid pro quo.

res ipsa loquitur.usage: Negligence inferred from nature of accident.
res ipsa loquitur.example: Res ipsa loquitur applied to the accident.

res judicata.example: Suit is barred by res judicata.

sine qua non.example: Negligence is the sine qua non.

ultra vires.example: Order was ultra vires the statute.

volenti non fit injuria.meaning: To a willing person, no injury is done
volenti non fit injuria.example: Dismissed under volenti non fit injuria.
